body:
I agree with @davecheney I would prefer to keep the language as simple as possible.

It seems like this change would be convenient for a large company using lots of dependencies but it will be confusing to average or new users.

It seems most packages hit a point where they attempt to make non-breaking changes and if breaking changes are required they provide a new version.  A change like this overtime could lead to a lot packages becoming very confusing if they make to much use of aliases.
